title: Martyna Majok on Hoping for Magic, and Wishing for Ghosts
description: The playwright, whose Pulitzer-winning “Cost of Living” is now on Broadway, talks about “the precarity of life” and our inherent need to be taken care of.
dc:creator: Laura Collins-Hughes
media:credit: Dina Litovsky for The New York Times
media:description: The playwright Martyna Majok at the Samuel J. Friedman Theater, where her play “Cost of Living” is having its Broadway debut. As tinged with longing as her play is, it’s also laugh-out-loud funny.
